  • Method Details

    • selectItemFromElement

      @When("^I select (?!the)(.*?) (?:in|from) the (.*)$") public static void selectItemFromElement​(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String elementName) throws SentinelException
      Selects the given option in the select element, then stores the selected value in the Configuration Manager using the element name as the key. Fails if the option doesn't exist or the element is not visible on the page. This method takes two strings. The first string is text of the option to select. The second is made lower case and whitespaces are replaced with underscores, then it is sent a select event to an element defined on a page object with that name. The page object and driver object are defined by the WebDriverFactory and PageFactory objects. The derived Page Object (extends Page) should define a method named [element name]_[element type] returning a PageSelectElement object (e.g. password_field).

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I select bob in the name dropdown
      • I select Brady from the Last Name list
      • I select Doctor from the providers list
      NOTE: The word "the" cannot be used as the beginning of an option to select. This is to disambiguate the method from the method allowing you to select an ordinal option. If you wish to use the word "the" as part of an option, you will need to write a custom step.

      Parameters:
      text - String the text of the option to select
      elementName - String the name of the select element
      Throws:
      SentinelException - this exists so that any uncaught exceptions result in the test failing

    • selectOrdinalItemFromElement

      @When("^I select the (\\d+)(?:st|nd|rd|th) option (?:in|from) the (.*)$") public static void selectOrdinalItemFromElement​(java.lang.String ordinal, java.lang.String elementName) throws SentinelException
      Selects the ordinal option on the element and then stores the text value of that selection in the Configuration Manager using the element name as the key.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I select the 1st option in the name dropdown
      • I select 2nd option from the Last Name list
      • I select the last option in the Providers list
      NOTE: Numbering start with 1, not 0 to make the cucumber step more human-readable to business owners who do not need to understand numbering in programming usually starts at 0.

      Parameters:
      ordinal - String the ordinal selection (numbering starts with 1)
      elementName - String the name of the select element
      Throws:
      SentinelException - this exists so that any uncaught exceptions result in the test failing
